channel.title: Vertical Navigation Bar
channel.description: With the website template I'm trying to make right now, I decided to use a vertical navigation bar. The problem I've encountered is that everything I add under the navigation bar, is directly under it; rather than beside it. So, my question is now, what can I do with css to align everything that is after the navigation code on the right side of it. I've tried using 'margin-left', but I also want to be able to center things for different browser sizes.

item.title: Vertical Navigation Bar
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I figured out how I could do it. I used the ‘float’ property.

Read full topic

item.title: Vertical Navigation Bar
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

a { display:block; width:60px; }

ul { list-style-type:none; margin:0; padding:0; }

Depends how you want to do it

Read full topic
